alert.note: Alert for Doddridge; Gilmer; Harrison; Lewis; Ritchie; Tyler (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 6:50AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Ritchie, Doddridge, northeastern Gilmer, northern Lewis, southeastern Tyler and Harrison Counties through 715 AM EDT... At 649 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pennsboro to 6 miles north of Glenville. Movement was east-northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clarksburg, Weston, Stonewood, Nutter Fort, Salem, Pennsboro, Lumberport, West Union, Anmoore, Jackson Mill, West Milford, Lost Creek, Jane Lew, Pullman, Auburn, Grangeville, Alma, Wolf Summit, Newberne, and Mountain. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 near mile marker 95, and between mile markers 99 and 119. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, seek shelter inside a building until the storms pass. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Doddridge; Gilmer; Harrison; Lewis; Ritchie; Tyler
